metadata.title: CVE-2022-3594 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - negligible
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been declared asproblematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function intr_callbackof the file drivers/net/usb/r8152.c of the component BPF. The manipulationleads to logging of excessive data. The attack can be launched remotely. Itis recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The associatedidentifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211363.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
